title: Selma To Montgomery National Historic Trail: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations        Reservations Groups of 10 or more wanting to schedule a 20-30 minute Ranger-Led Program should contact the Lowndes Interpretive Center, (334) 877-1983 or the Selma Interpretive Center, (334) 872-0509 at least two weeks in advance to schedule a reservation. Programs are available at 9:30 AM, 11:00 AM, 1:30 PM and 3:00 PM, Monday - Saturday. School groups are asked to supply a minimum of one adult chaperone for every 10 students.  If there are students with special needs, please indicate the type of need for the student when you call.  Â     Permits  Special uses of National Park Service facilities are allowed by permit only. A fee may be charged for use of park facilities during and after normal operating hours. Special Use applications are approved at the discretion of the Park Superintendent. Mail all Special Use forms 4-6 weeks in advance of your requested event to: Tuskegee Institute National Historic Site Attn: Shirley Baxter 1212 W. Montgomery Rd. Tuskegee Institute, AL 36088 Phone: (334) 727-3200  Filming and Photography For information about conducting your film or photo project at the National Park Service facilities along the Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail please download this form.
